result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jamie L Shales

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Activity: Adjourned initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

1:07 PM Defendant Jamie L Shales appeared by audio.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy in court for Jamie L Shales.  Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing requested by Zoom and time limits are waived. Court adds additional condition to bond that defendant is to sign bond at the courthouse by October 21, 2022.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription. No possession of drug paraphernalia. Maintain absolute sobriety. Cannot operate a motor vehicle during pendency of case without valid drivers license or insurance. Must sign bond Friday October 21, 2022 by 4:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription. No possession of drug paraphernalia. Maintain absolute sobriety. Cannot operate a motor vehicle during pendency of case without valid drivers license or insurance.

Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature bond set of $1000 with conditions. Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription. No possession of drug paraphernalia. Maintain absolute sobriety. Cannot operate a motor vehicle during pendency of case without valid drivers license or insurance. Defendant to sign bond by 09/23/2022.
